page.title: 09GEOGRAPHIC LANDSCAPE
page.content: It is mainly flat farmland and woodland,surrounded by the South Downs .There is a stream running across the area which eventually flows into the river Ouse at Lewes.The railway runs from Lewes through Plumpton village towards Haywards Heath,on the Victoria line.There is a lot of watery land,because of the mills.There are many farms,because this is the main industury of the area.The soil is a mixture of chalk and clay.The weald is a bed of clay on which little grows except oak trees.The whole area is mostly covered by grass and wheat with some woodland.This has some of the best oak trees than any other place in Britain.The clay is useful because there were a lot of brickyards around here,which was once the main industry
